headline: SLOWLY AND HESITANTLY, INDIA ADOPTS BIRTH CONTROL

headline: BIRTH CONTROL: STERILIZING RELIED ON
snippet: Voluntary sterilization is the most widely used method of birth control in the United States, according to a study released this week by Ms. magazine.   The study was conducted by the Alan Guttmacher Institute and published in a pamphlet called...

headline: U.S. DROPS EFFORTS FOR NOTICE OF CHILD'S BIRTH CONTROL USE
snippet: The Reagan Administration has given up its attempts to force federally aided birth control clinics to notify the parents before prescribing contraception for unmarried teen-agers.   Claire del Real, a spokesman for the Department of Health and...

headline: Men and Birth Control
snippet: That men and women should share the responsibility for contraception is a tenet that's easy to endorse and difficult to put into practice. It may be 20 years before a new male contraceptive is marketable, so birth control could remain a mostly...

headline: Study Finds Possible Hazard In Using Birth Control Device
snippet: A new study reports a possible link between use of intrauterine birth control devices by nursing mothers and damage to the uterus, but experts say there is not enough evidence to recommend that they stop using IUD's.   The study, made by...

headline: WHY A LAG IN MALE-ORIENTED BIRTH CONTROL?
snippet: Though science's understanding of male reproductive physiology has leapfrogged in the last decade, the research has not yet produced effective, easy-to-use contraceptives for men. Only one method, the century-old condom, is both as effective and...

headline: China Says Many Defy Its Birth Control Policy
snippet: China's family planning chief says many Chinese families are still having more than one child despite a Government policy discouraging this.   ''There are certain districts where family planning programs are very well accepted,'' said Qian...

headline: Drawing the Line On Birth Control

headline: CHINA'S VITAL BIRTH-CONTROL EFFORT DOES NOT INCLUDE INFANTICIDE

headline: U.S. Told Not to Impose Its Birth Control Rule
snippet: A Federal judge issued a permanent injunction today that forbids the Government to carry out its so-called squeal rule on providing birth control aids to teen-agers.   The regulation had ordered family planning clinics that receive Federal money to...

headline: Ouster Asked for Author Of Birth Control Rule
snippet: A women's consumer group mounted a petition drive today calling for dismissal of the author of the proposal that would require parental notification when teen-age girls received contraceptives from federally financed clinics.   The National Women's...

headline: BIRTH-CONTROL RULE IS BLOCKED

headline: U.S. Plans to Appeal Ruling On Teen-Ager Birth Control

headline: JUDGE BARS FEDERAL BIRTH-CONTROL RULE FOR MINORS

headline: Birth-Control Rule Challenged

headline: BIRTH-CONTROL RULE: CLINICS PONDER EFFECTS

headline: WHEN BIRTH CONTROL IS NOT ENOUGH

headline: New Birth Control Rule Near
